item.title: Sydney live music venue embraces grant for soundproofing amid noise complaint concerns
item.description: When the Red Rattler theatre in Sydney's inner west installed acoustic foam in the walls behind its stage, it didn't just make the venue soundproof — but future-proof.

item.title: Toni Jordan spent her childhood at the greyhound track, inspiring her new novel Tenderfoot
item.description: The acclaimed author's father was a greyhound trainer and her mother ran a TAB. Her unconventional childhood inspired her eighth book, Tenderfoot.

item.title: 3D-printed guns, internet-ordered drugs on the list for Crime Stoppers in Tasmania
item.description: While they may look strange, even toy-like, 3D-printed weapons can still be deadly — and they are high on the watchlist for police in Tasmania.

item.title: Northern Territory Corrections Department honours 20th anniversary of Elders Visiting Program in prisons
item.description: A decades-long partnership between Indigenous elders and the Northern Territory’s prison system is helping prisoners reconnect with culture and encouraging them to turn their lives around.

item.title: Netball final scoring error sparks resignation in Wimmera Football Netball League rivalry
item.description: A botched score in a western Victorian netball league final has led to a senior official resigning and a police escort at the rival clubs' football match as tensions between the clubs remain.

item.title: Islamophobia has been 'persistent' and 'ignored', envoy says — as it happened
item.description: A long-awaited report into Islamophobia in Australia has been handed down, with the special envoy finding it has been "persistent" and "ignored".

item.title: Kiama by-election could signal voter mood across NSW
item.description: The Kiama by-election this weekend is more than a fight for one seat. It could reveal how voters view the state's major party leaders after scandal and political upheaval.

item.title: Outback hairdresser a 'hero' to Wilcannia residents longing for a pampering
item.description: The "salon" is an op shop and the round-trip commute's a doozy, but Juliann Mutch is happy to go the extra distance to pamper her grateful Wilcannia clientele.

item.title: How Jamal Fogarty learned to be the hero Canberra needed for its premiership charge
item.description: Jamal Fogarty has spent a rugby league lifetime waiting to play on a team like the Raiders. Now with the NRL finals approaching, he's ready for his close-up.

item.title: Voter turnout as low as 10 per cent in NT local elections
item.description: Two out of five of the NT's enrolled voters failed to vote in the jurisdictions recent local government elections, with experts concerned voting fatigue has taken hold.

item.title: Albany residents call for lower speed limits after van strikes pedestrian at crossing
item.description: A crash involving a van and an 81-year-old woman in Albany prompts calls for reduced speed limits from locals and road safety advocates.

item.title: What happens to your data when you trade or recycle your device?
item.description: A cybercrime expert says trading or recycling electronics may not completely erase personal data and users should adopt a "risk-adjusted strategy" when disposing of devices.

item.title: Netball Australia, players strike revenue-sharing deal in collective player agreement
item.description: Netball Australia and the players' association strike a landmark revenue-sharing deal as part of a three-year collective player agreement.

item.title: Qatar's prime minister accuses Israel of ignoring Gaza hostages in attack on Hamas in Doha
item.description: The Qatari prime minister tells the United Nations Security Council that Israel went "beyond any borders" with the strike and says Benjamin Netanyahu is to blame for killing "any hope for those hostages".

item.title: Murray Watt stamps final approval of Woodside's North West Shelf extension to 2070
item.description: Australia's biggest gas project, Woodside's North West Shelf, has received final approval to extend operations through until 2070.

item.title: China announces new nature reserve on contested Scarborough Shoal
item.description: China says its newly announced reserve is about preserving coral, but the Philippines says it is another step towards Bejing tightening its claim on a contested, strategic area of the South China Sea.

item.title: The simple system I use for composting
item.description: Koren Helbig has devised an easy and effective method of turning her food waste and plant trimmings into a nutrient-rich compost for her Adelaide/Tarntanya food gardens.

item.title: Australia to face Belgium in Davis Cup in Sydney with Final 8 spot up for grabs
item.description: Lleyton Hewitt's Australian Davis Cup team is ready for another fierce battle with old foes Belgium as they chase a spot in this year's Final 8 in Italy.

item.title: Islamophobia envoy calls for religious discrimination laws, review of approach to counter-terrorism
item.description: In a landmark report, newly-appointed Aftab Malik also calls for counter-terrorism laws and approaches to be reviewed, and for national inquiries into Islamophobia and anti-Palestinian racism.

item.title: Quote Quiz: Who said it, Lachlan Murdoch or Succession's Kendall Roy?
item.description: As Lachlan Murdoch's ascension to the head of the family business is cemented, can you tell his quotes apart from Succession's self-proclaimed "eldest boy", Kendall Roy?

item.title: Artists and users boycotting Spotify over AI use and CEO's military tech
item.description: A growing number of artists and users are leaving Spotify. What's changed with the streaming giant? And what comes next?

item.title: Independent accreditation system for fertility sector to be established as all recommendations of IVF review accepted
item.description: Federal Health Minister Mark Butler has announced he has accepted all recommendations of a rapid review into the IVF sector at a meeting with state and territory health ministers in Perth.

item.title: Mop-top virus found in potatoes bought from retail stores in Tasmania
item.description: Biosecurity Tasmania is working to trace the origins of the two potatoes, as potato mop-top virus continues to spread through Tasmania.

item.title: Tasmanian government consulting on public homebirth model
item.description: A proposal by the Tasmanian government to introduce a public homebirth model has been welcomed by those in the sector.

item.title: British YouTube creator Yung Filly to travel home to UK on bail for sexual assault charges
item.description: British YouTube content creator Yung Filly, who's facing trial in Perth on sex assault charges, is granted permission to travel home to the UK for the first time since he was arrested.

item.title: Judge awards man $450k in damages after ex-premier's police officer son falsified evidence
item.description: A Supreme Court judge has awarded NSW man Luke Moore $450,000 in damages after the disgraced police officer son of former senator Kristina Keneally falsified evidence about alleged death threats.

item.title: NRL finals: Melbourne Storm defeat Canterbury Bulldogs 26-18, Stephen Crichton injured
item.description: Bulldogs coach Cameron Ciraldo feels his side was let down by the refereeing performance in their 26-18 defeat to the Storm in their qualifying final.

item.title: Australian basketballer Tiana Mangakahia dies of cancer aged 30
item.description: The family of Australian basketballer Tiana Mangakahia has paid tribute to the former Opals and WNBL player, describing her as a "shining light" after her death from cancer at the age of 30.

item.title: Gold miners drive ASX higher as bullion price hits new record
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Matildas to face England Lionesses in October international window
item.description: The Matildas have announced an international friendly against England this October, the first time they will face the European champions since the semifinal of the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup.

item.title: Pacific leaders reaffirm support for Taiwan's right to attend regional forum
item.description: Despite pressure from Beijing, Pacific leaders have backed Taiwan's right to attend the Pacific Islands Forum.

item.title: Tyler Robinson, 22, in custody after manhunt for conservative activist Charlie Kirk's killer
item.description: US authorities arrest a man who they say confessed or "implied" to a family friend that he killed right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: South Korean workers return home after ICE raids at US Hyundai factory
item.description: The workers arrived home to emotional scenes as many consider never returning to the US following the raids which have caused serious tension between the longstanding allies.

item.title: Sushila Karki sworn in as Nepal's new prime minister after gen Z protests prompt political change
item.description: Sushila Karki garnered widespread support from many young Nepalese people who took to the streets in anger over government corruption.

item.title: Donald Trump and his 'good man' Anthony Albanese share some common ground
item.description: The MAGA president's grip on the Republican party is near total while Albanese holds a sway over his left-leaning caucus like few of his Labor predecessors.

item.title: Netanyahu and Putin escalate their wars as Trump looks on
item.description: In the Middle East and in Europe, political leaders are making their own arrangements in the absence of US leadership.

item.title: Former minister Greg Hunt works for Brethren company whose owners made millions on COVID contracts
item.description: The Sydney-based church has been described by former members and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese as a "cult".

item.title: NATO announces operation 'Eastern Sentry' in response to Russian drone incursion in Poland
item.description: NATO announces plans to beef up the defence of Europe's eastern flank two days after Poland shot down Russian drones that had violated its airspace.

item.title: North West Shelf extension comes at critical juncture in Australia's climate conversation
item.description: Seven years after it was first mooted, the extension of Australia's biggest gas project could not have landed at a more critical juncture for the nation's climate credentials.

item.title: Australians watched the moment of Charlie Kirk's assassination on social media with no warning
item.description: Young Australians say they are seeing graphic video of US commentator Charlie Kirk being shot dead pop up in their social media algorithms without warning.

item.title: Evidence points to remains found in Vietnam cave being South-East Asia's earliest known homicide victim
item.description: It was on a sweltering morning in 2018 in a cave in northern Vietnam when Chris Stimpson and his team uncovered what may be the oldest cold case murder in South-East Asia.

item.title: Elderly Porepunkah woman left without in-home care as Freeman manhunt continues
item.description: Elderly residents of Porepunkah have had their home nurse visits cancelled as alleged police killer Dezi Freeman remains at large.

item.title: Journey Home, David Gulpilil shows the film icon's remote homeland 'for the first time'
item.description: Legendary Yolŋu actor David Gulpilil held an ambition throughout his career to share a part of himself and his culture that the world had never seen before. A new documentary does exactly that.

item.title: Nepal's gen Z protesters are continuing the fight for their future even after picking a new prime minister
item.description: A calm has fallen on Nepal's streets after days of violence and chaos. But leaders of the gen Z protest movement say the work's not done.

item.title: Female farmers determined to defy NSW dairy industry exodus
item.description: As repeated natural disasters and stagnating milk prices see dairy farmers walk away from the industry, these women are looking at smaller changes to help shore up their future.

item.title: More than a dozen women complain about Brisbane doctor accused of performing 'sexually motivated' checks
item.description: Dr Stan Theodoros is facing disciplinary proceedings, lodged by Queensland's health ombudsman, in the Queensland Civil and Administrative Tribunal (QCAT).

item.title: A Sydney council's $378k battle against Woolwich marina expansion
item.description: Locals have argued if the expansion in Woolwich were to go ahead it "would be like putting a bus station in the middle of a children's playground".

item.title: Keio Yoshida tells queer stories differently in their new book, Pride and Prejudices
item.description: In their latest book, author and human rights lawyer Keio Yoshida draws on their personal experience and legal expertise to demonstrate the importance of sharing queer stories.

item.title: Yorke Peninsula businesses worry tourists won't return if algal bloom continues over summer
item.description: After a cold winter, a warm spring is often a welcome time for towns that rely heavily on tourism. But for regional South Australian coastal communities hit hard by the ongoing algal bloom, there's a feeling of concern about what should be a busy period.

item.title: Adrianne Lenker on Big Thief's evolution and the making of Double Infinity
item.description: At the peak of their success, Big Thief faced a major emotional rupture that reshaped the group from the inside out. Now, they've returned with their sixth album, shaped by deep creative trust and a renewed commitment to collaboration.

item.title: Wallaroos primed for Rugby World Cup quarterfinal against Canada
item.description: Considered underdogs against the world number two, the Wallaroos are urged to be bold in their sudden-death encounter in Bristol.

item.title: Who is Tyler Robinson, the accused killer of Charlie Kirk?
item.description: After his father encouraged Tyler Robinson to turn himself in, people close to the 22-year-old provided investigators with crucial insights.

item.title: Astronomer Grote Reber's ashes are held in radio telescope locations around the world
item.description: Grote Reber helped spark decades of interest in radio astronomy in Tasmania when he decided to call the southern state home.

item.title: Nourishing and easy sweet potato and lentil bowls - ABC News
item.description: This jazzy little bowl is made from simple ingredients. The sweet potato is roasted gently with spices and tinned lentils are roasted until crisp.

item.title: Recyclers aim to stop 30,000 tonnes of mining tyres being buried every year
item.description: Australia's mining industry has been burying enormous, worn out tyres for decades. But a new facility is offering a solution.

item.title: Suns coach Damien Hardwick praised ahead of historic finals clash against Lions
item.description: Brisbane Lions great Alastair Lynch hails the impact of Damien Hardwick at the Gold Coast Suns as they look to continue their run in the finals.

item.title: Rare good news for critically endangered east coast grey nurse sharks
item.description: Scientists say increasing numbers of east coast grey nurse sharks is rare good conservation news for the critically endangered species.

item.title: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital cancels children in war discussion citing staff safety
item.description: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital says a symposium on the effect of war on children has been cancelled due to safety fears, but some doctors say pressure from a group opposing antisemitism is to blame.

item.title: Bush band tells Aboriginal people's side of the Maralinga nuclear weapon tests story
item.description: For Liam Tunkin, making music is about continuing his late father's legacy and sharing a dark part of Australia's history.

item.title: Wallabies fall to 28-26 defeat against Argentina in The Rugby Championship in Sydney
item.description: The Wallabies have fallen just short of a magical comeback against Argentina, losing 28-26 in a thrilling Rugby Championship Test in Sydney.

item.title: Erika Kirk makes first public statement after assassination of husband Charlie Kirk
item.description: Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, delivers her first public remarks since the fatal shooting of her influencer husband.

item.title: Advocates call for action on brain health as AIHW reveals dementia is leading cause of death
item.description: Advocates warn the number of people with the condition could exceed 1 million without government intervention.

item.title: Penrith Panthers, Cronulla Sharks win NRL elimination finals against Warriors, Sydney Roosters
item.description: The Sharks are looking to correct the mistakes of the past, as they advance to the semifinals with a 20-10 victory over the Roosters.

item.title: Supreme Court gives Queensland hospital permission to terminate 12yo girl's pregnancy
item.description: A 12-year-old girl in residential care in Queensland should be allowed to have an abortion, a court rules, after a judge found she was not capable of making the decision herself.

item.title: NRLW wrap: Brisbane Broncos thrash the Cowboys 50-4, Gold Coast grab last finals spot
item.description: It's a big day for Queensland sides in the NRLW, as the Broncos — led by skipper Tamika Upton — are far too good for the third-placed Cowboys, while the Titans clinch the last finals spot with a win over Canberra.

item.title: AFLW wrap: Collingwood ends Sydney's unbeaten run, Carlton thumps Gold Coast, the Power beats the Demons
item.description: Collingwood, wooden spooners last season, keep Sydney goalless for more than three quarters at home on Saturday for an upset win, as Port Adelaide beat another unbeaten side in Melbourne.

item.title: WA Health issues measles warning as two more cases linked to Bali travel
item.description: West Australians planning to visit South-East Asia are being urged to get vaccinated against measles, with two more cases linked with travel to Bali.

item.title: Labor win Kiama by-election as voters replace disgraced MP Gareth Ward
item.description: The NSW Premier said Kiama now has the ear of the government after it claimed victory in the by-election triggered by the resignation of convicted rapist Gareth Ward.

item.title: Brisbane far too good for Gold Coast in QClash semifinal, setting up Collingwood prelim date
item.description: Bouncing back from a resounding loss to Geelong, the Brisbane Lions comfortably dispense of the Gold Coast Suns to advance to the preliminary finals.

item.title: Albanese government pours $12 billion into expanding AUKUS defence facility near Perth
item.description: The Albanese government will spend $12 billion on building a submarine and naval shipbuilding facility south of Perth under AUKUS, as doubts linger over the agreement's future.

item.title: Nepal authorities lift curfew for Kathmandu and surrounding areas after gen Z protests
item.description: The curfew was lifted after Nepal swore in its first female prime minister, following deadly protests.

item.title: London anti-immigration protesters scuffle with police, who promise 'many more' arrests
item.description: The march was organised by far-right activist Tommy Robinson while a counter protest by anti-racism campaigners also took place as the country continues to be dogged by the issue of immigration.

item.title: Australia and Papua New Guinea to 'totally integrate' military in defence treaty, minister says
item.description: Australia is set to "totally integrate" its military with Papua New Guinea's forces, PNG's defence minister has said, as the two countries prepare to sign a landmark treaty.

item.title: From Formula One to creating the 'world's best' croissant, how baking saved Lune founder Kate Reid's life
item.description: Kate Reid's Lune croissants have been called the world's best. But how did a young woman struggling with a near-fatal eating disorder end up perfecting pastry?

item.title: Children missing out on early intervention for language delays due to shortage of speech pathologists
item.description: One in four children starting school now has a speech or language delay. It can hold back their learning, affect their friendships and harm their mental health. Speech therapists are struggling to find ways to support them all, but one school is leading the way.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.description: US Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr's anti-vaccination agenda is gaining ground, but resistance is coming from all sides.

item.title: Understanding the literal bin fires in Europe's 'magical mystery summer' of inaction
item.description: Moscow's drone incursion into Polish airspace this week may have just laid bare how fruitless Europe's summer of talkfests has been.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Think you're contestant material? Prove it
item.description: It's time to show me your exceptional trivia knowledge. Ha!

item.title: 'Bone lady' who helped find Daniel Morcombe still unearthing stories of the dead
item.description: From the search for Daniel Morcombe to a flaming roadside torso, Queensland's top forensics cop deals with some of the state's worst crimes — when she's not identifying fallen Australians on WWI battlefields.

item.title: Aboriginal artist Emily Kam Kngwarray becomes first Australian with solo exhibition at London's Tate Modern
item.description: Emily Kam Kngwarray has been recognised as "one of the world's leading artists" after becoming the first Australian whose work is the subject of a solo exhibition at the Tate Modern Gallery in London.

item.title: Wallaroos' Rugby World Cup hopes dashed by dominant Canada in 46-5 loss
item.description: The Wallaroos miss the chance to reach the Rugby World Cup semifinals, losing heavily 46-5 to Canada in Bristol.

item.title: The Pacific won a stunning climate victory at the International Court of Justice. What's next?
item.description: Pacific Island nations are weighing up how to use a historic international court ruling in their fight to bring about stronger emissions reductions and climate justice.

item.title: How fear of being 'cringe' is holding young people back
item.description: A psychologist says the growing online phenomenon of "cringe" is making young people avoid doing things they fear are embarrassing, sometimes to their detriment.

item.title: Charlie Kirk's accused killer Tyler Robinson awaits formal charges in Utah
item.description: Tyler Robinson, jailed on suspicion of fatally shooting right-wing activist Charlie Kirk, faces formal charges in Utah early next week.

item.title: Lord Howe Island detection dog Sebbi retires to Brisbane after years of 'hard work'
item.description: It might be hard to leave the one of the most idyllic places in Australia, but it is not a case of paradise lost for this retiring pest-hunting pooch.

item.title: World-famous bee sanctuary on Kangaroo Island under threat from Varroa mite
item.description: Beekeepers on Kangaroo Island are demanding that biosecurity measures be boosted to prevent a deadly parasite from wiping out the island's world-famous bee sanctuary.

item.title: 'White-hot anger' in the bush as Victorians fight government on multiple fronts
item.description: Rural residents and local councils are deeply unhappy with new taxes, renewable energy, bad roads and mining companies, accusing the state government of "city centric" policymaking.

item.title: Inaugural Blue says club has reached a 'turning point' after challenging years
item.description: Inaugural Carlton player Gab Pound says the club has reached a turning point after not making the finals since the 2020 COVID-interrupted season.

item.title: Brick-pit frog recovery another win for green and gold at Sydney Olympics site
item.description: Twenty-five years after the Sydney Olympics, an important Homebush planning decision has led to successful conservation efforts for a species born in the green and gold. But a deadly fungus poses a threat.

item.title: 'Where to now?' Liberals soul searching after heavy loss in Kiama by-election
item.description: For a party that had just suffered a heavy defeat, the mood at the Liberals' post-election event was surprisingly upbeat on Saturday night.

item.title: Wombat makes home in Robe's main street as numbers increase despite habitat loss
item.description: A wombat has made its home in the main street of Robe, evidence of an influx of the animals in the South Australian fishing town.

item.title: The Franklin River rescue was extreme. Here's how medics prepare for the wilderness
item.description: The Franklin River rescue was an extreme test for the skills of medics. In remote Tasmania, here's how they train for "chaos".

item.title: Outback nurse transforms remote diabetes care with cans, rocks and bush tucker
item.description: When Rishoniy Caine arrived in a remote NSW community with one general store and no gym, she knew fixing its diabetes problem would need a different approach to what had already failed the locals.

item.title: The federal press gallery is ceding power to the Albanese government
item.description: The federal press gallery is ceding power to the Albanese government. It needs to take it back.

item.title: How to watch the 2025 Primetime Emmys in Australia
item.description: Your pocket guide to watching the Emmy awards in Australia.

item.title: Victorian farmers welcome spring forecast despite long-term climate concerns
item.description: As spring brings a flicker of hope, some farmers cautiously embrace optimism while others face mounting pressures and climate uncertainty.

item.title: Residents in flood-affected communities want more warning technology
item.description: For generations, farmers and outback communities have relied on the bush telegraph during floods but it has fallen silent in recent years, leaving residents without up-to-date information.

item.title: Donald Trump threatens new sanctions on Russia if NATO suspends all oil purchases
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he is ready to impose sanctions on Russia, but only if NATO members agree to do the same, as well as set massive tariffs on Russia's main ally, China.

item.title: All Blacks forced to re-group after 43-10 loss to Springboks in Rugby Championship
item.description: After a demoralising 43-10 loss to the Springboks on home soil, the All Blacks are looking to rebound against the Wallabies in the upcoming Bledisloe Cup Tests.

item.title: Creamed honey nostalgia helps producers find niche market
item.description: Some New South Wales beekeepers are determined to stay the course in the face of varroa mite, turning to childhood memories for inspiration.

item.title: Sharp drop in Gouldian finch sightings sparks worry in WA
item.description: Numbers of the brightly coloured Gouldian finch appear to be dropping in Western Australia's East Kimberley.

item.title: Victoria set to have first new national parks in more than a decade
item.description: Conservation groups are celebrating proposed legislation for three new national parks in Victoria but not all bush users are happy.

item.title: Platypuses found dead in illegal fishing traps in regional Victoria
item.description: Anglers are urged to dispose of illegal fishing nets and stick with safer open-top traps, after two platypuses are found drowned in regional Victorian waterways.

item.title: 'World's biggest' hockey game in York fundraises for cancer research
item.description: More than 370 people participate in a hockey game lasting more than eight hours in honour of a little girl who died from a rare form of cancer earlier this year.

item.title: Sussan Ley reshuffles frontbench in wake of Jacinta Nampijinpa Price saga
item.description: West Australian MP Melissa Price will replace Jacinta Nampijinpa Price as the shadow minister for defence industry and personnel, after the outspoken senator was sacked for refusing to back her leader.

item.title: How to give your indoor plants a spring clean
item.description: As gardens, parks and nature strips start showing signs of spring, our indoor plants might need a little help to jump into the new season.

item.title: In the midst of destruction in Gaza, these parents found 'paradise' through adoption
item.description: A newborn baby was left in a Gaza hospital, the sole survivor of a deadly Israeli strike which killed her family. A couple who had struggled to have children of their own knew they had to provide her with a home.

item.title: Lachie Neale gives himself '50 per cent' chance of improbable grand final appearance after calf injury
item.description: Lachie Neale admits medical professionals are not holding out much hope of him recovering from a calf injury in time for the grand final, but he is not giving up.

item.title: Ben Hunt's Golden Point field goal sends Brisbane Broncos into NRL prelims after downing Canberra Raiders in all-time classic
item.description: Jamal Fogarty scores a try in Golden Point to send the Raiders to a preliminary final only for it to be disallowed before Ben Hunt delivers a dagger field goal.

item.title: FBI director Kash Patel to face congressional hearing amid missteps on Charlie Kirk assassination
item.description: Kash Patel faces a clear test of whether he can convince the country that the FBI, under his watch, can avoid compounding its mistakes in a time of political violence and deepening distrust.

item.title: AFLW Round 5 Sunday wrap: Kangaroos claim grand final rematch against Lions as Saints and Cats record big wins
item.description: North Melbourne continues its blistering start to the AFLW season as Geelong and St Kilda also record big wins in Round 5.

item.title: Belgians break Australian hearts in Davis Cup classic
item.description: Beligum's Raphael Collignon wore down late stand-in Aleksandar Vukic in the deciding rubber to lead Belgium to the quarter-finals.

item.title: Reece Walsh grabs the Sun to lead Brisbane to an all-time victory over Canberra
item.description: Brisbane and Canberra went to the great beyond in their golden point finals match and it was Reece Walsh who led the Broncos to the promised land.

item.title: Plymouth Brethren attempted to silence alleged rape victim with a million dollars and a non-disclosure agreement
item.description: The controversial church offered to settle with Mick Dover over his allegations of abuse, but only if he signed a non-disclosure agreement and agreed not to disparage them in any way.

item.title: Liberal Party immigration fight is a battle over how the party wants to position itself
item.description: Immigration has become a new fault line inside the Liberal Party that will erupt again.

item.title: The year Australia is due to blow its carbon budget
item.description: Unless Australia lifts its ambitions, its "fair share" of carbon emissions will be spent 14 years early. With the government announcing a 2035 climate target this week, there is intense debate on how high the government should aim — and whether it will be enough to help limit global warming.

item.title: The higher Australia's 2035 emissions target, the more necessary a carbon tax will be
item.description: Australia's emissions reduction number is, in short, a laugh-or-cry-o-meter, or perhaps more accurately, a tax-o-meter.

item.title: GIM Trading accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors with 'low risk' bonds
item.description: A Gold Coast musician approached by a man he knew from a local bar went on to front a trading company, later accused of defrauding millions from ordinary Australian investors.

item.title: Dads leaving sex education to mums, report finds, with concerns young boys are missing out
item.description: New report finds mothers do more of the sex education at home, raising concerns that young boys are missing out on key information from their dads.

item.title: Family violence survivors waiting years for social housing as demand surges in Victoria
item.description: As family violence survivor and mother-of-two, Maya was assessed as a high priority for social housing. Eight years later, she's finally moved into a suitable home in outer-suburban Melbourne, with vulnerable Victorians left waiting for years as the social housing waitlist soars.

item.title: Weather to warm up in Queensland, as more rain forecast for the north
item.description: The southern half of Queensland can expect fine weather at least for the first half of the week, while more rain is on the way for the north of the state.

item.title: Antarctic expeditioners join research project to help astronauts on space missions
item.description: Expeditioners at Australia's Antarctic stations are taking part in a research project to better understand the cognitive and physiological impacts of extended deployments — which can include actual "brain shrinkage".

item.title: SA government error in your favour — collect $1 million
item.description: Political parties usually get in trouble for breaking their election promises. But what happens when they keep a promise that never actually existed?

item.title: How Sydney's Olympic legacy continues to unfold, 25 years on
item.description: Largely regarded as one of the most successful modern Olympics, years of work went into ensuring Sydney could fully capitalise on its moment in the spotlight.

item.title: Residents say former Moe Hospital could become public housing
item.description: A retired nurse who worked at Moe Hospital says the closed facility could be used for housing rather than left to further rot.

item.title: Charlie Kirk shooting suspect not cooperating with authorities, Utah governor says
item.description: Investigators are working to piece together why Tyler Robinson allegedly scaled a rooftop at Utah Valley University during an outdoor event and shot Mr Kirk in the neck at long range.

item.title: Sam Kerr scores 100th goal for Chelsea in long-awaited WSL return from knee injury
item.description: Matildas star Sam Kerr scores her 100th goal for Chelsea just minutes after returning to the pitch for the Blues for her first game since 2023.

item.title: Road repairs after flood delayed by 'excruciating' eligibility criteria
item.description: Victorian councils say they are required to provide before-and-after photos of every 100 metres of road in order to be eligible for flood recovery funding.

item.title: Nepalese migrants in Australia turning to parents to help with childcare and culture
item.description: For many Nepalese families living in Canberra, the arrival of parents from overseas is both a helping hand with raising children and a connection to their homeland.

item.title: Documents reveal unauthorised sediment releases at Blackwater Coal Mine
item.description: A report obtained by lobby group Lock The Gate under right-to-information laws reveal a mine in central Queensland was releasing sediment into environmentally sensitive areas for more than a decade.

item.title: Fortunes change quickly in AFLW as round of upsets shakes up ladder
item.description: After a tough start to the year, Geelong sit just outside the top eight and equal on points with the reining grand finalists.

item.title: ANZ hit with a record $240m fine for 'unconscionable' conduct, ASX claws back early losses — as it happened
item.description: ANZ has been hit with a massive fine for unconscionable conduct impacting 65,000 customers, ranging from the federal government to dead account holders.

item.title: Traditional custodian readies for 'challenge' over North West Shelf gas project extension
item.description: Environment Minister Murray Watt approved the extension of Australia's biggest gas project last week.

item.title: Specialist GPs to diagnose ADHD in WA amid calls for further easing of restrictions
item.description: As a select cohort of WA GPs begins to diagnose ADHD in people older than 10, parents of younger children and some medical professionals have expressed concerns about the scheme.

item.title: ANZ faces record $240m penalty for ripping off customers and government
item.description: ANZ bank has agreed to a record penalty with the corporate regulator over its dealings with about 65,000 customers, as well as the federal government.

item.title: Reece Walsh fined for headbutt, Pat Carrigan banned for high shot in NRL finals win over Canberra
item.description: Superstar Broncos fullback Reece Walsh will be free to play in the NRL preliminary finals after avoiding suspension for a headbutt on Hudson Young in Brisbane's epic win on Sunday.

item.title: Emmys 2025 red carpet: Jenna Ortega, Lisa, Sydney Sweeney, Aimee Lou Wood, Walton Goggins, Selena Gomez and Pedro Pascal
item.description: The stars of the television industry are bringing the drama with their fashion choices.

item.title: WA's expanded container deposit scheme to cost wineries, distilleries millions
item.description: Producers in Western Australia's premier wine region say the state government's expanded bottle recycling scheme is set to cost them millions of dollars.

item.title: Australia beats India in first of three ODIs before Women's Cricket World Cup
item.description: Australia's Cricket World Cup preparations are in full swing as three batters score half-centuries in a big run chase in the first of three ODIs against India.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2025: The Pitt, Adolescence and The Studio win big as Owen Cooper makes history — as it happened
item.description: The Pitt wins Best Drama at the 77th Annual Primetime Emmy Awards, with The Studio, Adolescence and even Stephen Colbert walking away as the biggest winners of the night.

item.title: Port Hinchinbrook marina remains inaccessible despite dredging project
item.description: Mud and silt continue to choke the channel connecting the controversial development to the Great Barrier Reef, once again putting industry and conservationists at odds over the fix.

item.title: Land tax exemption 'reinterpretation' leaves Mudgee winery facing huge bill
item.description: Revenue NSW hits a Mudgee winery with a $150,000 land tax, despite the property being exempt for almost 50 years.

item.title: Outback ringmaster Fred Brophy takes his boxing tent to Birdsville for last time
item.description: Fred Brophy will sell you a ticket, spin you a yarn and dare you into the ring, but at 73, the outback ringmaster is slowing down.

item.title: First climate risk assessment finds 1.5m Australians at risk from sea level rise by 2050
item.description: One and a half million Australians are at risk from sea levels rising by 2050 unless climate change can be limited, Australia’s first national climate risk assessment warns.

item.title: Nepal's Gen Z demands reform as country begins new political path
item.description: Protesters in Nepal say their Gen Z-led movement was not just about removing one leader, but about reforming the system to ensure accountability and protect Nepal’s future.

item.title: From Tantanoola to Essendon, Angus Clarke reflects on AFL season
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Russia accused of breaching Romanian airspace with drone amid NATO unease over Poland attack
item.description: Russia is accused of breaching Romania's airspace by sending in a kamikaze Geran-2 drone.

item.title: Australian rules football and SANFL administrator Max Basheer dies aged 98
item.description: Max Basheer — the football administrator who oversaw the creation of the Adelaide Crows and the purpose-built stadium Football Park — has died aged 98.

item.title: AFL State of Origin will return, with Western Australia-Victoria clash confirmed
item.description: AFL chief executive Andrew Dillon confirms Western Australia will play Victoria in Perth next February in the first State of Origin match since 1999.

item.title: Prince Harry says he has no regrets about 2023 memoir Spare
item.description: Prince Harry has defended his tell-all autobiography Spare, insisting he has no regrets about its publication.

item.title: Man charged with giving Nazi salute at Brisbane Lions v Gold Coast Suns AFL game at the Gabba
item.description: A 39-year-old man has been charged with giving a Nazi salute at the AFL semifinal in Brisbane on Saturday night.

item.title: Indian cricketers refuse to shake hands with Pakistani counterparts at Asia Cup
item.description: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav refuses to shake hands after his side's seven-wicket win over Pakistan at the Asia Cup in the latest controversial episode between the two rivals.

item.title: Sydney Roosters confirm ACL injury for Tarryn Aiken on eve of NRLW finals
item.description: Tarryn Aiken will miss the Sydney Roosters' NRLW finals campaign, with scans confirming a knee injury that will require a knee reconstruction.

item.title: Alphonce Felix Simbu wins marathon gold at World Athletics Championships
item.description: After running for more than two hours, the winner of the men's marathon at the World Athletics Championships was decided by less than a second.

item.title: Inquest hears prison system failed Aboriginal inmate before he died
item.description: A coronial inquest hears the system failed First Nations prisoner Clinton Austin before his death.

item.title: Emmys 2025 winners: Adolescence, Severance, The Pitt and The Studio win big
item.description: The 77th Primetime Emmy Awards are honouring the best and brightest in the US television industry. Here are the shows that picked up the trophies.

item.title: Anthony Albanese blames move from electorate office on Sydney pro-Palestinian protesters
item.description: Anthony Albanese has blamed pro-Palestinian protesters for the closure of his electorate office in Sydney's inner west, but the landlord says there were multiple reasons behind the decision to discontinue the long-standing lease.

item.title: NFL week two: Dallas Cowboys win thriller, Steelers botch kick-off, Travis Kelce drops
item.description: The second Sunday of NFL football for the season did not disappoint, with rivals producing a classic and a rematch of the Super Bowl.

item.title: Arhab Haque sprayed fart gas at restaurants for TikTok clout, court hears
item.description: An amateur mixed martial arts fighter sprayed fart gas in a fast food restaurant so he could make TikTok prank videos, a Perth court hears.

item.title: Starving wallabies at The Briars spark urgent Mornington Peninsula Shire council meeting
item.description: A study prompted by the deaths of wallabies at a beloved wildlife reserve south of Melbourne finds the population has grown five times larger than what The Briars sanctuary can sustain.

item.title: SA to roll out ChatGPT-style AI app in all high schools as tech experts urge caution
item.description: A ChatGPT-style app to be rolled out at all South Australian high schools next term has been welcomed by tech experts, who are also warning its use should be carefully managed.

item.title: 2025 Emmys key moments: From Hacks star Hannah Einbinder's acceptance speech to chants for Stephen Colbert
item.description: From a rallying political cry from Hacks star Hannah Einbinder to standing ovations for Stephen Colbert, here are your Emmys 2025 key moments.

item.title: How much fish is in tinned tuna, and how to shop for your needs
item.description: When you're at the supermarket, do you wonder how much much tuna you're getting in a can? A series of popular social media has been comparing how much food there is in some packaged items.

item.title: How is Australia affected by climate change? The National Climate Risk Assessment models the future
item.description: For the first time, the government has modelled the threats from climate change on Australia's future. What’s the point of a document like this, and can it help us avoid the worst-case scenarios?

item.title: Hundreds of pigs feared dead at Dublin's Andgar piggery after fire breaks out
item.description: Emergency crews are at the scene of a fire at a large piggery north of Adelaide that is subject to cruelty allegations.

item.title: Cricket Tasmania seeking ways to make proposed Macquarie Point stadium 'compatible' for matches
item.description: After initial concerns that the roof design of the proposed Hobart AFL stadium at Macquarie Point would hinder cricket matches, sporting authorities have thrown their support behind the build, saying "we will find a way".

item.title: Australia's richest person among hundreds of donors to NT senator's legal fund
item.description: Australia's richest person, Gina Rinehart, has helped fund Senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price's crowd-funded defence to a defamation action brought by the head of a Northern Territory land council.

item.title: Pasifique Zawadi Niyonyishi sentenced to life in prison for murder of Colin Norton
item.description: A man who killed an elderly man as well as stabbing his wife and dog in a "callous and senseless act of unimaginable violence" has been sentenced to life in prison.

item.title: Defence dilemma facing Anthony Albanese as he heads to New York
item.description: Amid uncertainty over whether the prime minister will secure his first one-on-one meeting with Donald Trump, the political test is whether his recent defence commitments will be seen as a genuine step-up on capability or a sidestep from American calls to spend more.

item.title: Trial of trio accused of 2022 stabbing murder of David Wayne Jenkins hears from friends of co-accused
item.description: A murder trial has heard one of the co-accused men was "scared", "frantic", "very, very sweaty" and "swearing to God he didn't do it" after a confrontation in which a man died of stab wounds.

item.title: Prime suspect in Madeleine McCann disappearance refuses UK police interview
item.description: Christian Brueckner lived in Portugal's Algarve region at the time the three-year-old vanished in 2007 and was first named as a suspect by British and German police in 2020.

item.title: Support announced for businesses affected by Dezi Freeman search
item.description: Funding has been welcomed by Porepunkah businesses that were struggling after visitors were urged to stay away.

item.title: Photos emerge of property where Dezi Freeman lived prior to deadly shooting
item.description: Photos have revealed a chaotic scene inside the Porepunkah property where Dezi Freeman is alleged to have shot and killed two police officers.

item.title: Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson found to have breached code of conduct
item.description: Troy Thompson will be reprimanded and ordered to pay all costs after he was found to have breached the council's code of conduct.

item.title: Inmate tells inquest guards referred to Indigenous man who died in custody with derogatory slurs
item.description: An inmate, who cannot be named, provided details of an Indigenous man's treatment in custody, as an inquest into the man's death continues.

item.title: Newcastle Knights announce Justin Holbrook as new NRL head coach
item.description: Sydney Roosters assistant coach Justin Holbrook has been named the new head coach of the Newcastle Knights.

item.title: 'Outspoken' retired Catholic Bishop Pat Power dies, aged 83
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Canberra Catholic Bishop Pat Power remembered as 'outspoken supporter for the poor and marginalised'
item.description: Bishop Pat Power is being remembered as a much-loved Canberran who leaves a legacy of compassion and hope.

item.title: Baby girl dies, child seriously injured after being hit by car at Minto Mall car park
item.description: Emergency crews were called to the car park of Minto Mall about 3:30pm on Monday afternoon, where the baby and five-year-old child had been struck by a car.

item.title: Shadow minister Andrew Hastie says he will be 'without a job' if Liberals don't abandon net zero
item.description: Liberal frontbencher Andrew Hastie indicates he will quit or be dumped from the shadow cabinet if the Coalition does not abandon the target of achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050.

item.title: Donald Trump vows national emergency in Washington DC after ICE dispute with Democrat mayor
item.description: The US president's threat comes after Washington DC Mayor Muriel Bowser said the district's police would not cooperate with Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

item.title: Whispering Jack: The John Farnham Musical to premiere in Sydney Theatre Company's 2026 season
item.description: Whispering Jack: The John Farnham Musical is one of 13 plays coming to Sydney Theatre Company next year, alongside shows starring David Wenham and Miranda Otto.

item.title: NRL announces preliminary finals dates, Melbourne Storm on Friday, Brisbane Broncos play Sunday
item.description: The NRL has shaken up its preliminary finals weekend, electing to host one of its grand final qualifiers on a Sunday for the first time in 18 years.

item.title: Armand Mondo Duplantis breaks world record, Kurtis Marschall wins pole vault bronze at World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo
item.description: Kurtis Marschall wins bronze in the men's pole vault final on day three of the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, as Armand Duplantis soars to a 14th world record.

item.title: Millions of dollars allegedly scammed by GIM Trading
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: ANZ faces record penalty for ripping off customers and the government
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Leadership of the Australian National University is in turmoil
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: All the latest financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Demonstrators bring Melbourne CBD to a halt again
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Former Roebuck Bay Hotel manager Stewart Burchell denies indecently assaulting staff
item.description: Taking the stand in his District Court trial, Stewart Burchell says allegations he raped a former staff member and indecently assaulted others "did not happen".

item.title: Final rules for social media ban set to be revealed, with no legally-enforceable effectiveness standard
item.description: While substantial fines would apply to social media platforms that make no effort to ban under-16s, they would not need to test the age of every user.

item.title: Timor-Leste students protest government plan to buy new cars for parliamentarians
item.description: About 1,000 students hit the streets of the capital to rally against the plan, before police clashed with some protesters who reportedly threw rocks and damaged properties.

item.title: Landmark trial begins for British soldier accused of Bloody Sunday murders
item.description: The ex-paratrooper — identified only as Soldier F — faces two murder and five attempted murder charges over the 1972 atrocity in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Israel's Benjamin Netanyahu won't rule out striking Hamas 'wherever they are' as Marco Rubio visits
item.description: The remarks were made as US Secretary of State Marco Rubio visited Israel seeking answers from Mr Netanyahu about how Israel intended to proceed in Gaza.

item.title: US and China agree to Tiktok 'framework' ownership agreement at trade talks in Spain
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the framework would see the platform switch to US ownership.

item.title: Britain summons Russian ambassador following violation of NATO airspace in Poland and Romania
item.description: A foreign office spokesperson says Russia's incursions into NATO airspace were "utterly unacceptable", adding that the UK stands united with its NATO allies in condemning the "reckless actions".

item.title: Former MMA fighter Conor McGregor drops out of Irish presidential race
item.description: Critics say the former MMA fighter's pre-emptive dropout was to save face in a likely knockout at the hands of Dublin City Council.

item.title: Australia-PNG defence treaty will require countries to 'act' if either one is attacked
item.description: Australia and Papua New Guinea will be legally obliged to defend each other from a military attack on either territory under a landmark defence treaty, the ABC can reveal.
